sect1.title: Genesis Introduction
sect1.para: Genesis is a collection of technologies that is treated as a network appliance. Genesis is used to configure and manage network (PXE) booted server farms.

sect1.title: Hardware requirements
sect1.para: Genesis can on any x86 architecture Linux platform.*** not exclusive

sect1.title: Software
sect1.para: Genesis is designed to run on Linux operating systems. It is currently runs on Ubuntu 12.04 (but it is possible that it will work on other operating systems as well.)

sect2.title: Genesis Operating System Requirements
sect2.para: You will need one of the following:

listitem.para: 64-bit LINUX CentOS 5.x / Red Hat Enterprise Linux / Scientificrisk/pan***

sect2.title: Genesis Client Operating System Requirements
sect2.para: You will need one of the following:

listitem.para: 64-bit LINUX CentOS 5.x / Red Hat Enterprise Linux***

sect2.title: Dependencies***
sect2.para: Installing HPCC on your system depends on having required component packages installed on the system. The required dependencies can vary depending on your platform. In some cases the dependencies are included in the installation packages. In other instances the installation may fail, and the package management utility will prompt you for the required packages. Installation of these packages can vary depending on your platform. For details of the specific installation commands for obtaining and installing these packages, see the commands specific to your Operating System.
